page.title: 02Religion in Stogumber
page.content: There are two{religious } {buildings}in Stogumber.The Church of Our Lady St.Mary,{Church of England,is a{14th century}stone building with a tower in the High Street.The interior contains two alters,an octagonal font,stone pulpit,fine candelabra and stained glass windows.The tomb of George Sydenham,father-in-law of Sir Francis Drake,can be found in the Sydenham Chapel.Services held twice on Sundays and on other Feast days are taken by the Rector.The Electoral Roll has 121 members,about 30 attend Church regularly. The{Baptist Church}is a small stone building in Brooks Street,built in about{1750.}A special feature of the interior is the Baptistry where adults are baptised by total immersion.The Membership roll has 17 members 10 attend services regularly.
